Title: United States-China trade war and its implications to Indonesia's economy and the world
Authors with affiliations: Darman, K.H., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: The main objective of this research is to find out the impact of US President Donald Trump's protectionism policy and its implications for the world economy and Indonesia. This study uses quantitative descriptive methods, with multiple linear regression analysis with SPSS. Hypothesis testing uses the F-test with a significance of α = 0.05. Data used annually for the period 2011-2019 are sourced from the Central Statistics Agency (BPS) and Bank Indonesia (BI). This study found that simultaneously the US-China trade war significantly affected the growth of the world economy and Indonesia. The end of this study concluded that the US-China trade war had an impact on the economic growth of the US, China, the World and Indonesia. The implication is that the government needs to encourage exports to be greater than imports so that the impact of the trade war will be implemented positively for the Indonesian economy. Therefore, the US-China trade war needs to be stopped so that it does not have an impact on the economic recession in the future. © 2019 by Advance Scientific Research.
Author Keywords: Economic Growth; Trade Balance; Trade War
Funding Text 1: We Thank Mrs. Enggal (Binus University) for the contribution to data analysis, and also thank Mr. Ariusmar (Binus University) for technical writing and language.
